author: Special Correspondent
text:
Participating in a seminar — organised by the Consulate General of Japan in Chennai and ABK-AOTS Dosokai, Tamil Nadu Centre — that dwelt on the importance of social inclusion of the disabled Prabhakaran Ramachandran, chairman, Pravda Law Associates, appealed to the Consulate General of Japan, Seiji Baba, to try and ensure that the over 1,000 Japanese companies situated in India employed people with disabilities.

Law in Japan

“In Japan, the law ensures that the private sector gives 1.6 per cent employment to people with disabilities. Unfortunately in India, the law on 3 per cent reservation only applies to the government sector,” he said.

Kyoko Ogawa, Japanese language adviser, Japan Foundation and M.R. Ranganathan, chairman, ABK-AOTS Dosokai, Tamil Nadu Centre, were among those who participated.

At the event, school students were given a glimpse of Japanese culture, including art forms such as origami and ikebana, a flower arrangement.

Videos on robots, bullet trains and schoolchildren in Japan were screened as part of the event.

Japanese companies in city are encouraged to offer employment to the disabled
title: Plea to employ people with disabilities
